channel.title: Omegle wtf?
channel.description:
Ok, I was with some friends messing around on Omegle and this weird ass dude got into a chat with us and within 10 seconds had all of the information you see below. He then proceeded to flood my router or whatever and make my internet fuck up until I was able to call my isp and have them fix it. How the fuck did he do this?
[IMG]http://i61.tinypic.com/30mo2l4.png[/img]

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

People use TOR just because they like to stay anonymous while browsing, but a majority of the users just use it to access the SilkRoad blackmarket…

Read full topic

@Pwnd wrote:

"Tor can be used by people with governments that censor their Internet (like residents of the U.K. or China)"
Criminals

Read full topic

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:15, topic:546102”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=664998.msg4445846#msg4445846 date=1408761694]
do anyone other than druggies use tor
[/quote]Is there really any other reason to use Tor other than being a criminal?[/quote]There’re plenty of uses to use Tor if you aren’t a criminal. You people are getting the absolute wrong impression. Tor can be used by people with governments that censor their Internet (like residents of the U.K. or China) or by police to actually catch paedophiles. Maybe people just want to use it for something private, too.

[quote=“nolan2131, post:4, topic:546102”]He said he was going to stab me and send the swat to my house.[/quote]You can still contact the police about this. The police deal with petty prank calls, I’m sure they’d have time for this.

To OP, it’s because Omegle uses a P2P connection (peer to peer). You’re connecting directly to their computer from yours, so they can find out your IP fairly trivially. All of the information he posted can be found out by just an IP. It’s not Omegle’s problem; there’s nothing they can do.

Read full topic

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:7, topic:546102”]so omegle connects clients directly instead of talking through the server?

depending on your router you might be able to disable responding to ping and port scanning, and enable some form of dos protection[/quote]
As far as I know, yes. Looks like they do have some form of a server for connecting clients.
I found this and believe it might help with how Omegle works.
https://www.hackthissite.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=37&t=3783&sid=4b0608904fe4e418af9ff42462d37ee1
But the topic is from 2009 so it could easily be outdated.

Read full topic

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Lol I’m not that worried about it, just a pain in my ass to have my isp have to stop the gentlemen from flooding my router. They supposedly filed a report with his information, but whatever. Thanks for clearing this up skater.

Read full topic

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

nolan2131:

He said he was going to stab me and send the swat to my house.

Oh no. A threat on the internet? That’s not the first time it’s ever happened.
If you really are uncomfortable with this entire situation, you can report it to your local police department. Cyber crimes like this have been rising over the years, and some places actually give a shit about them. I don’t happen to live in one of those places, but you may have better luck.

Also, that geolocation crap he pulled up comes from geoIP.
https://www.maxmind.com/en/locate_my_ip
^That, when on my actual connection, pulls up my address.

Edit:
http://www.intelligentexploit.com/articles/The-(in)security-of-Omegle---What-Omegle-users-should-know.pdf

Read full topic

item.title: Omegle wtf?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Lol @ the Troy Polamalu jersey in the back…

Anyways. You’re on the internet. When you connect two clients together (you, and him) through the server (omegle’s web servers, etc), they receive the information he posted. All he did was use some form of a program to sniff the data as his computer received it. Therefore making it possible for him to do exactly what he just did.

Same thing happens when people use skype resolvers and etc. They are grabbing the information that your computer is sending via a sniffer, and then using it against you.

Read full topic
